meta.name: description
meta.content: The Williamsport Area School District provides learning opportunities, support, and activities for children K-12 with a focus on career exploration.

meta.name: keywords
meta.title: Grow As You Go | Williamsport Area School District

div.p: As mandated by Gov. Tom Wolf, all K-12 public schools in the Commonwealth are CLOSED for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.
Please read our latest updates on our COVID-19 response plans by clicking here.
All WASD school events, activities and performances, including athletics, are cancelled.

div.style: position: absolute; height: 120px; top: -120px; left: 0; right: 0; background-color: #da0324;

div.strong: By the order of Gov. Tom Wolf, all schools in the Commonwealth will remain CLOSED for the remainder of academic year. For continued updates and information, please click here. (Last update: April 18, 2020 — 8:56 a.m.)

div.p: Stay in the know about what’s going on with our calendar of events. Join us and share our Millionaire pride!
div.a: VIEW CALENDAR
Learn More about School Board Meeting on05

strong.a: School Board Meeting

div.div: The School Board meets the first and third Tuesday of each month. Click "Learn More" to see additional upcoming meeting dates.

div.a: Learn More about School Board Meeting
Learn More about Memorial Day Break on25

strong.a: Memorial Day Break

div.div: All schools and district offices will be closed on Monday, May 25.

div.a: Learn More about Memorial Day Break

div.div: Last day of school and a half day for all students.

div.class: col-12 col-md-5 col-lg-3 text-right d-flex flex-column align-item-center justify-content-center featuredIntroBlock order-md-2
div.p: Stories and achievements about our students and staff doing amazing things in the classroom and community.
div.a: VIEW ALL NEWS

a.span: Image for Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates & Information

strong.a: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates & Information

div.div: The health and safety of our students and staff is a top priority. With the recent news reports of cases of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Pennsylvania, we want to ensure families that WASD is working to stay well informed and developing an action plan in the event a case is confirmed in or around Lycoming County.

div.a: Read More about Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates & Information

a.span: Image for 5 WASD OM Teams Advance to State Finals

strong.a: 5 WASD OM Teams Advance to State Finals

div.div: Five Williamsport Area School District Odyssey of the Mind teams that competed at the Regional Tournament in Berwick on Saturday are headed to the State Finals.

div.a: Read More about 5 WASD OM Teams Advance to State Finals

a.span: Image for #FutureReady Feature: Early Childhood Education

strong.a: #FutureReady Feature: Early Childhood Education

div.div: Watch as Williamsport Area High School juniors Nassir Jones and Isaiah Williams and seniors Gaige Falk and Kevar Lattie talk about their early pursuit of a career in education through the high school's Early Childhood Education program.

div.a: Read More about #FutureReady Feature: Early Childhood Education

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation to Participate in Raise the Region

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation to Participate in Raise the Region

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation once again will participate in Raise the Region, the 30-hour online fundraising event hosted by the First Community Foundation Partnership of Pennsylvania. It begins at 6 p.m. Wednesday, March 11, and ends at 11:59 p.m. on Thursday, March 12.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation to Participate in Raise the Region

a.span: Image for 2020-2021 District Calendar Now Available

strong.a: 2020-2021 District Calendar Now Available

div.div: The Williamsport Area School District 2020-2021 District Calendar is now available for download.

div.a: Read More about 2020-2021 District Calendar Now Available

a.span: Image for 'Hour of Code,' Title 1 Nights Showcase Innovative Educational Practices

strong.a: 'Hour of Code,' Title 1 Nights Showcase Innovative Educational Practices

div.div: Lycoming Valley and Curtin Intermediate schools hosted a combined "Hour of Code" and Title 1 at each of their locations on Jan. 28 and Feb. 5, respectively. The events celebrated not only literacy, but also provided an opportunity for families to experience all the innovative ways students are learning in the classroom.

div.a: Read More about 'Hour of Code,' Title 1 Nights Showcase Innovative Educational Practices

a.span: Image for WASD Students Honor School Board Members in Annual Recognition Ceremony

strong.a: WASD Students Honor School Board Members in Annual Recognition Ceremony

div.div: In recognition of our Board of Education, students from across the district honored them for their service by presenting them with a brand-new book for installation in their respective school libraries. Each of the books is dedicated to the individual board member with a nameplate on the inside cover.

div.a: Read More about WASD Students Honor School Board Members in Annual Recognition Ceremony

a.span: Image for 5 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

strong.a: 5 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

div.div: Five eighth-grade students at WAMS recently were recognized for earning regional Scholastic Art & Writing Awards. Three earned the coveted Gold Key Award and two earned Honorable Mentions.

div.a: Read More about 5 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

a.span: Image for Cochran Primary Named 2019-2020 Title 1 Distinguished School

strong.a: Cochran Primary Named 2019-2020 Title 1 Distinguished School

div.div: Cochran Primary has been named a 2019-2020 Title 1 Distinguished School by the Pennsylvania Department of Education. Cochran is one of 93 across the Commonwealth selected for ranking among the top 5 percent of Title 1 schools that exhibited academic growth during the two most recently completed school years.

div.a: Read More about Cochran Primary Named 2019-2020 Title 1 Distinguished School

a.span: Image for WASD Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Set for March 23-27

strong.a: WASD Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Set for March 23-27

div.div: Welcome to the Class of 2033! The Williamsport Area School District’s kindergarten and new student enrollment week for the 2020-2021 school year is scheduled for March 23 through March 27 at the District Service Center, 2780 West Fourth St.

div.a: Read More about WASD Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Set for March 23-27

a.span: Image for Curtin, Lycoming Valley Announce 'YAM JAM' Events

strong.a: Curtin, Lycoming Valley Announce 'YAM JAM' Events

div.div: Curtin and Lycoming Valley Intermediate schools will host their annual YAM-JAM events in March. Together, the events will celebrate National Youth Art and Music in Our Schools month, but honor it separately through different themes.

div.a: Read More about Curtin, Lycoming Valley Announce 'YAM JAM' Events

a.span: Image for WAMS Students Raise, Donate Funds to WBP's K-9 Unit

strong.a: WAMS Students Raise, Donate Funds to WBP's K-9 Unit

div.div: WAMS students donated $870 to the Williamsport Bureau of Police's K-9 Unit Friday morning. Members of the school's Positivity Club and Builders Club raised the funds by collecting donated dog and cat treats to package and sell.

div.a: Read More about WAMS Students Raise, Donate Funds to WBP's K-9 Unit

a.span: Image for WASD Awarded $35,000 PAsmart Grant to Implement New AP Computer Science Course

strong.a: WASD Awarded $35,000 PAsmart Grant to Implement New AP Computer Science Course

div.div: WASD learned last week through State Sen. Gene Yaw’s office that it is among other local school districts to receive a $35,000 PAsmart grant. Funds from the grant will be used to implement a new AP computer science course in 2020-2021.

div.a: Read More about WASD Awarded $35,000 PAsmart Grant to Implement New AP Computer Science Course

a.span: Image for WAHS Junior to Compete at Poetry Out Loud State Championship

strong.a: WAHS Junior to Compete at Poetry Out Loud State Championship

div.div: WAHS junior Oam Patel will compete at the Poetry Out Loud state championship on March 9 in Harrisburg after securing a first-place win at the regional level in Towanda on Friday, Jan. 17.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Junior to Compete at Poetry Out Loud State Championship

a.span: Image for WASD's All-District Orchestra Concert Set for Feb. 3

strong.a: WASD's All-District Orchestra Concert Set for Feb. 3

div.div: The WASD music department will present its 45th annual All-District Orchestra concert on Monday, Feb. 3, at 7 p.m. in the auditorium at WAHS. The program will feature the talents of more than 450 students in grades four through 12.

div.a: Read More about WASD's All-District Orchestra Concert Set for Feb. 3

a.span: Image for WAHS Junior Raises, Donates $18,076 to Local Charities

strong.a: WAHS Junior Raises, Donates $18,076 to Local Charities

div.div: WAHS junior Cecilia Fink’s charity Be You Boldly recently granted a combined $18,076 to K’s for Cancer and the River Valley Regional YMCA’s Livestrong Program.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Junior Raises, Donates $18,076 to Local Charities

a.span: Image for WASD Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

strong.a: WASD Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

div.div: WASD released its 2018-2019 Annual Report today, which highlights the district’s key activities, data and financials between July 1, 2018, and June 30, 2019. “We are pleased to introduce and share with you (the district's) first-ever annual report,” writes Superintendent Dr. Timothy S. Bowers and school board President Lori Baer.

div.a: Read More about WASD Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

a.span: Image for WAHS Promotes 'One in a Million' Message to Students

strong.a: WAHS Promotes 'One in a Million' Message to Students

div.div: On the theme of "You Are One in a Million(aire)," WAHS kicked off Mental Health Awareness Week with an exercise in self expression to "promote the idea that each student is special and contributes to our school in a positive way."

div.a: Read More about WAHS Promotes 'One in a Million' Message to Students

a.span: Image for WASD Statement on Myrtle Beach Incident

strong.a: WASD Statement on Myrtle Beach Incident

div.div: In light of recent concerns raised on social media, it is evident that the circulation of inaccuracies and misinformation have created confusion that is detrimental to students, staff and the district. The district is releasing the following statement to provide facts where we are legally able to do so, while still protecting the privacy of students.

div.a: Read More about WASD Statement on Myrtle Beach Incident

a.span: Image for Lycoming Valley Intermediate Raises $3,005 for Make-a-Wish

strong.a: Lycoming Valley Intermediate Raises $3,005 for Make-a-Wish

div.div: Thanks to a penny war challenge at Lycoming Valley Intermediate School, students did their part to help grant children's wishes, raising a staggering $3,005.16 for Make-a-Wish Foundation!

div.a: Read More about Lycoming Valley Intermediate Raises $3,005 for Make-a-Wish

a.span: Image for School Board Approves 1st Reading of Food Service Policies; Seeks Wellness Committee Members

strong.a: School Board Approves 1st Reading of Food Service Policies; Seeks Wellness Committee Members

div.div: The WASD Board of Directors recently approved the first reading of several food service-related policies. In addition, the district is seeking volunteers interested in serving on the Wellness Committee.

div.a: Read More about School Board Approves 1st Reading of Food Service Policies; Seeks Wellness Committee Members

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest Winners Celebrated

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest Winners Celebrated

div.div: Winners of the Williamsport Area School District Education Foundation's Holiday Essay Contest enjoyed a night of celebration on Wednesday night.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest Winners Celebrated

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation (WASDEF) today released its 2018-2019 Annual Report that highlights the organization’s key activities and financial statements between July 1, 2018, and June 30, 2019.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Releases 2018-2019 Annual Report

a.span: Image for WAHS Hosts 30th Annual Holiday Concert

strong.a: WAHS Hosts 30th Annual Holiday Concert

div.div: The WAHS music department held its 30th annual Holiday Concert on Dec. 15. Free and open to the public, the concert has become known as “a gift to the community.”

div.a: Read More about WAHS Hosts 30th Annual Holiday Concert

a.span: Image for Jackson Primary Students Collect, Donate Items for Veterans

strong.a: Jackson Primary Students Collect, Donate Items for Veterans

div.div: Jackson Primary School conducted a drive for items to donate to the Wilkes-Barre VA Medical Center through November. Items were collected to benefit local veterans that use the facility as a resource for needed items.

div.a: Read More about Jackson Primary Students Collect, Donate Items for Veterans

a.span: Image for 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

strong.a: 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation recently concluded its annual Holiday Essay Contest, during which students in kindergarten through third grade were asked to answer, in 200 words or less: “What are you most thankful for during the holiday season and why?”

div.a: Read More about 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

a.span: Image for WAMS Holds Production of "Elf the Musical Jr."

strong.a: WAMS Holds Production of "Elf the Musical Jr."

div.div: The WAMS music department held its production of “Elf the Musical Jr.” this weekend. The play, starring Spencer Sponhouse as Buddy the Elf, Muireann Tran as Jovie, and Jack Heller as Walter Hobbs, is based on the 2003 holiday film.

div.a: Read More about WAMS Holds Production of "Elf the Musical Jr."

a.span: Image for WASD Names New Elementary Special Education Supervisor

strong.a: WASD Names New Elementary Special Education Supervisor

div.div: WASD named James DeSantis as its new Elementary Special Education Supervisor, effective date to be determined. DeSantis comes to the district from the Harris County School District in Hamilton, Ga., where he served as its special education director.

div.a: Read More about WASD Names New Elementary Special Education Supervisor

a.span: Image for WASD Names New Secondary Curriculum Supervisor

strong.a: WASD Names New Secondary Curriculum Supervisor

div.div: WASD named Dr. Chad Greevy as its new Secondary Curriculum Supervisor. Greevy comes to the district from Loyalsock Township School District, where he currently serves as its middle school principal.

div.a: Read More about WASD Names New Secondary Curriculum Supervisor

a.span: Image for Curtin Intermediate's #socktober Campaign Sets New Record, Collecting 5,398 Socks for Area's Homeless

strong.a: Curtin Intermediate's #socktober Campaign Sets New Record, Collecting 5,398 Socks for Area's Homeless

div.div: Curtin Intermediate set a new school record during its #socktober campaign last month, having collected 5,398 pairs of socks, shattering last year’s record-setting number of 5,001.

div.a: Read More about Curtin Intermediate's #socktober Campaign Sets New Record, Collecting 5,398 Socks for Area's Homeless

a.span: Image for Old Lycoming Township Police Thank Students with Visit

strong.a: Old Lycoming Township Police Thank Students with Visit

div.div: Old Lycoming Township Police Chief Joseph Hope and Officer Shyanne McKivison stopped by Hepburn-Lycoming Primary School this morning to thank Mrs. Barb Adair's and Ms. Lindsay Clark's third-grade classes for letters their students wrote to the department.

div.a: Read More about Old Lycoming Township Police Thank Students with Visit

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Awards 122 Books to Summer Readers, Elementary Libraries

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Awards 122 Books to Summer Readers, Elementary Libraries

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation announced today its distribution of 122 brand-new books to the elementary library system as part of its annual Building Libraries Through Literacy Program.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Awards 122 Books to Summer Readers, Elementary Libraries

a.span: Image for WAMS to Host First 'Pathways to Your Future' Career Fair

strong.a: WAMS to Host First 'Pathways to Your Future' Career Fair

div.div: Calling all employers, local colleges and recruiters: WAMS will host its first Pathways to Your Future Career Fair on Nov. 6. The event is an opportunity for seventh- and eighth-grade students to get a better understanding of the skills needed to become gainfully employed in the future.

div.a: Read More about WAMS to Host First 'Pathways to Your Future' Career Fair

a.span: Image for 'Battle of the Beltway' Powderpuff Benefit Returns to STA Stadium

strong.a: 'Battle of the Beltway' Powderpuff Benefit Returns to STA Stadium

div.div: WAHS is once again partnering with the Lycoming County United Way to host the third annual Battle of the Beltway Powderpuff Game. The event pits the WAHS Lady Millionaires against Loyalsock Township High School Lady Lancers in a game of flag football.

div.a: Read More about 'Battle of the Beltway' Powderpuff Benefit Returns to STA Stadium

a.span: Image for WAHS CTE Program Highlights Reviewed at Occupational Advisory Committee Meeting

strong.a: WAHS CTE Program Highlights Reviewed at Occupational Advisory Committee Meeting

div.div: About 50 industry representatives and educators from those that comprise several Career and Technical Education (CTE) programs at WAHS attended the program's fall occupational advisory committee meeting tonight.

div.a: Read More about WAHS CTE Program Highlights Reviewed at Occupational Advisory Committee Meeting

a.span: Image for WAHS Announces 2019 Homecoming Court

strong.a: WAHS Announces 2019 Homecoming Court

div.div: Williamsport Area High School announced this year's Homecoming Court. This year's Homecoming game is scheduled for Friday, Oct. 4, against Pittston Area High School.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Announces 2019 Homecoming Court

a.span: Image for WAHS Senior Named Commended Student in 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program

strong.a: WAHS Senior Named Commended Student in 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program

div.div: Williamsport Area High School senior Erin M. Reilly has been named a Commended Student in the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Senior Named Commended Student in 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Hosts 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Hosts 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation held its second Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event on Thursday, Sept. 26, in the Michael Ross Room at Trade and Transit Center II in downtown Williamsport.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Hosts 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

a.span: Image for Cochran Primary Students Offer Comfort to Pediatric Cancer Patients

strong.a: Cochran Primary Students Offer Comfort to Pediatric Cancer Patients

div.div: Third-grade students from Mrs. Stacy Holt's classroom at Cochran Primary School are hoping to bring a little bit of comfort to pediatric cancer patients.

div.a: Read More about Cochran Primary Students Offer Comfort to Pediatric Cancer Patients

a.span: Image for WASD Art Department Named '2019 Outstanding Visual Arts Community' by PAEA

strong.a: WASD Art Department Named '2019 Outstanding Visual Arts Community' by PAEA

div.div: The WASD art department has been recognized as a 2019 Outstanding Visual Arts Community from the Pennsylvania Art Education Association (PAEA) for its commitment to visual arts education.

div.a: Read More about WASD Art Department Named '2019 Outstanding Visual Arts Community' by PAEA

a.span: Image for 'SOCKTOBERFEST' to Return to Curtin Intermediate on Sept. 27

strong.a: 'SOCKTOBERFEST' to Return to Curtin Intermediate on Sept. 27

div.div: Curtin Intermediate invites the community back to help “kick it to poverty” from 5 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. on Friday, Sept. 27, for its fourth SOCKTOBERFEST. The kickoff event once again will help launch the school’s month-long sock drive to benefit Lycoming County’s homeless.

div.a: Read More about 'SOCKTOBERFEST' to Return to Curtin Intermediate on Sept. 27

a.span: Image for WASDEF, Central PA Food Bank Partner in Fundraiser to Benefit BackPack Program

strong.a: WASDEF, Central PA Food Bank Partner in Fundraiser to Benefit BackPack Program

div.div: WASD students will be able to benefit from an upcoming casual Friday next month through a first-of-its-kind, community-wide event scheduled for Oct. 18. WASDEF and the Central Pennsylvania Food Bank are joining forces in the area’s first Dress Down for Williamsport Schools Day.

div.a: Read More about WASDEF, Central PA Food Bank Partner in Fundraiser to Benefit BackPack Program

a.span: Image for Tim Montgomery Memorial Scholarship Fund Established

strong.a: Tim Montgomery Memorial Scholarship Fund Established

div.div: A new scholarship fund has been created at the WASD Education Foundation in memory of Tim Montgomery, Williamsport Area High School’s winningest coach. The Tim Montgomery Memorial Scholarship Fund was established by his family

div.a: Read More about Tim Montgomery Memorial Scholarship Fund Established

a.span: Image for WASD Launches 'Be Present' Campaign to Promote School Attendance

strong.a: WASD Launches 'Be Present' Campaign to Promote School Attendance

div.div: WASD has announced the launch of its new “Be Present” campaign, a school district-community call-to-action to promote the importance of being in school every day while also raising awareness against chronic absenteeism.

div.a: Read More about WASD Launches 'Be Present' Campaign to Promote School Attendance

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Awards $10,381 to Support New Piano Lab at WAHS

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Awards $10,381 to Support New Piano Lab at WAHS

div.div: A new opportunity this year will work to broaden student reach in the WAHS’s music program, thanks to grant funding provided in part by the WASD Education Foundation.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Awards $10,381 to Support New Piano Lab at WAHS

a.span: Image for William Kamkwamba to be Keynote Speaker at WASDEF's 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

strong.a: William Kamkwamba to be Keynote Speaker at WASDEF's 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation is pleased to announce the keynote speaker for its second Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event next month. William Kamkwamba will headline the Sept. 26 event, sponsored by Larson Design Group.

div.a: Read More about William Kamkwamba to be Keynote Speaker at WASDEF's 2019 Donor & Alumni Appreciation Event

a.span: Image for 3 Selected to Receive 2019 Distinguished Alumni Awards

strong.a: 3 Selected to Receive 2019 Distinguished Alumni Awards

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation has named three WAHS alumni who will receive the Foundation's 2019 Distinguished Alumni awards. These individuals have been notified of their selection and have been invited to accept their award at Foundation's second Donor and Alumni Appreciation Event on Sept. 26

div.a: Read More about 3 Selected to Receive 2019 Distinguished Alumni Awards

a.span: Image for 2019-2020 School Open House Schedule Announced

strong.a: 2019-2020 School Open House Schedule Announced

div.div: The Williamsport Area School District has announced the dates for its annual round of open houses to kick off the start of the 2019-2020 school year.

div.a: Read More about 2019-2020 School Open House Schedule Announced

a.span: Image for Find Locations of Free Summer Meals for Children, Teens

strong.a: Find Locations of Free Summer Meals for Children, Teens

div.div: Nutritious free meals are available for children and teens 18 and younger at several locations throughout Williamsport during the summer while school is out of session. Click on the headline to find a link to a mapping tool to find a site near you.

div.a: Read More about Find Locations of Free Summer Meals for Children, Teens

a.span: Image for Summer String Camp to Return to WAHS July 29-Aug. 1

strong.a: Summer String Camp to Return to WAHS July 29-Aug. 1

div.div: WASD once again will offer its four-day Summer String Camp to students of the district from July 29 to Aug. 1 at WAHS. The camp will run each day from 9 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Deadline to register is July 15.

div.a: Read More about Summer String Camp to Return to WAHS July 29-Aug. 1

a.span: Image for WAHS Student-Constructed Items to Go Up for Bid Online

strong.a: WAHS Student-Constructed Items to Go Up for Bid Online

div.div: The WAHS CTE department has seven items scheduled to go up for public bid through the online auction service Municibid.com. From hunting blinds to children's playhouses, the items are up for public purchase through a bidding process beginning Thursday, June 27

div.a: Read More about WAHS Student-Constructed Items to Go Up for Bid Online

a.span: Image for Entrance to WAHS from West Fourth Street to Close for Construction Monday

strong.a: Entrance to WAHS from West Fourth Street to Close for Construction Monday

div.div: WAHS's Millionaires Lane will close for construction beginning Monday, June 17, from the West Fourth Street entrance up to (but not including) the high school bus loop. The closure is expected to last several weeks.

div.a: Read More about Entrance to WAHS from West Fourth Street to Close for Construction Monday

a.span: Image for WASD Looks Back at 2018-2019 Year; Bids Farewell to Retirees

strong.a: WASD Looks Back at 2018-2019 Year; Bids Farewell to Retirees

div.div: Today WASD celebrated the work accomplished together this school year by taking a look back at the 2018-2019 highlights. The ceremony also included a farewell and a tribute to the more than 30 retirees this year, who leave behind more than 743 years of combined experience.

div.a: Read More about WASD Looks Back at 2018-2019 Year; Bids Farewell to Retirees

a.span: Image for 'WASD Gives Back': 530+ District Employees Serve Community

strong.a: 'WASD Gives Back': 530+ District Employees Serve Community

div.div: In a show of community 530+ strong, Williamsport Area School District employees were out in the community this morning at more than 20 locations.

div.a: Read More about 'WASD Gives Back': 530+ District Employees Serve Community

a.span: Image for 311 Receive Diplomas at 148th Commencement Ceremony

strong.a: 311 Receive Diplomas at 148th Commencement Ceremony

div.div: WAHS's 2018-2019 academic year has just ended, and what a year it was. Tonight, 311 graduates proudly celebrated their achievements and received their diplomas.

div.a: Read More about 311 Receive Diplomas at 148th Commencement Ceremony

a.span: Image for WASD Announces Temporary Road Closure Beginning June 11

strong.a: WASD Announces Temporary Road Closure Beginning June 11

div.div: WAHS's Millionaires Lane will close temporarily for construction beginning Tuesday, June 11, from the Fox Hollow Road entrance to the high school bus loop. The closure is expected to last through Friday, June 21.

div.a: Read More about WASD Announces Temporary Road Closure Beginning June 11

a.span: Image for WASD to Conduct Evacuation Drill on June 7

strong.a: WASD to Conduct Evacuation Drill on June 7

div.div: Please be advised WASD will conduct an emergency evacuation drill from 12:30 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. on Friday, June 7. Any police or emergency service activity heard or seen at any of the district campuses are part of the planned drill.

div.a: Read More about WASD to Conduct Evacuation Drill on June 7

a.span: Image for 69 Students Celebrated, 38 Inducted at WAHS National Honor Society Ceremony

strong.a: 69 Students Celebrated, 38 Inducted at WAHS National Honor Society Ceremony

div.div: Sixty-nine WAHS students were celebrated tonight during the National Honor Society Ceremony, and, from among them, 38 were inducted as new members from the junior and senior classes.

div.a: Read More about 69 Students Celebrated, 38 Inducted at WAHS National Honor Society Ceremony

a.span: Image for WASD OM Teams Earn 3rd, 12th Place at 2019 World Finals

strong.a: WASD OM Teams Earn 3rd, 12th Place at 2019 World Finals

div.div: Two WASD Odyssey of the Mind teams each ranked among the top 15 at the 2019 World Finals. WAMS secured a division two, third-place win for “Leonardo’s Workshop” and Cochran Primary earned a division one, 12th-place spot for “Opposites Distract.”

div.a: Read More about WASD OM Teams Earn 3rd, 12th Place at 2019 World Finals

a.span: Image for 35 WAHS Students, Employers Recognized at Annual Appreciation Breakfast

strong.a: 35 WAHS Students, Employers Recognized at Annual Appreciation Breakfast

div.div: Thirty-five students involved in WAHS’s School-to-Work Program were honored during its annual Community Partners Appreciation Breakfast at the Genetti Hotel today.

div.a: Read More about 35 WAHS Students, Employers Recognized at Annual Appreciation Breakfast

a.span: Image for 6 WAHS Student-Athletes Sign to Play at College

strong.a: 6 WAHS Student-Athletes Sign to Play at College

div.div: Joined by friends, teammates, family and coaches, six WAHS students signed to play their respective sport at the collegiate level in the fall.

div.a: Read More about 6 WAHS Student-Athletes Sign to Play at College

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Grants $8,227 to 2 OM Teams Headed to World Finals

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Grants $8,227 to 2 OM Teams Headed to World Finals

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation granted $8,227 to the district’s Odyssey of the Mind teams headed to the World Finals this week at Michigan State University.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Grants $8,227 to 2 OM Teams Headed to World Finals

a.span: Image for WASD School Board Recognizes Outstanding Students

strong.a: WASD School Board Recognizes Outstanding Students

div.div: The Williamsport Area School Board continued its annual Outstanding Student presentations tonight. The presentations honor students who exemplify academic excellence and school citizenship from the top grade at each building.

div.a: Read More about WASD School Board Recognizes Outstanding Students

a.span: Image for WAHS Top Hat Dinner Honors Class of 2019's Top 5 Percent

strong.a: WAHS Top Hat Dinner Honors Class of 2019's Top 5 Percent

div.div: The Class of 2019’s top 5 percent were recognized tonight during the sixth annual Top Hat Dinner held at the Genetti Hotel. Eighteen seniors were celebrated for their academic excellence, as well as their selected faculty honorees who influenced and inspired that success.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Top Hat Dinner Honors Class of 2019's Top 5 Percent

a.span: Image for WASDEF Announces 14th Annual Golf Tournament Event Details

strong.a: WASDEF Announces 14th Annual Golf Tournament Event Details

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation will host its 14th annual Golf Tournament on Monday, June 24, at the Williamsport Country Club. Registration begins 11 a.m. with a shotgun start at 1 p.m. The tournament, presented by returning platinum sponsor Aramark, will benefit the Athletic Program Endowment Fund at WASDEF.

div.a: Read More about WASDEF Announces 14th Annual Golf Tournament Event Details

a.span: Image for WAHS Junior Snags World Championship Title in Swimming

strong.a: WAHS Junior Snags World Championship Title in Swimming

div.div: WAHS junior Lydia Smith has claimed a world championship title. Smith competed in the 2019 Pontevedra ITU Aquathlon World Championships, winning the competition over other female athletes in the 16-19 age group in Pontevedra, Spain, on May 2.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Junior Snags World Championship Title in Swimming

a.span: Image for 22 Students Honored During 12th Annual WASD Awards Exhibition

strong.a: 22 Students Honored During 12th Annual WASD Awards Exhibition

div.div: Congratulations to the 22 WASD art students who received awards for their work during the 12th annual WASD Awards Exhibition at the June Baskin Gallery in the District Service Center.

div.a: Read More about 22 Students Honored During 12th Annual WASD Awards Exhibition

a.span: Image for Notice: 2019-2020 Proposed Final Budget Available for Public Inspection

strong.a: Notice: 2019-2020 Proposed Final Budget Available for Public Inspection

div.div: On May 7, 2019, the WASD School Board formally adopted the Proposed Final Budget of expenditures for 2019-2020. The budget is available for public inspection from May 8-June 18 during business hours at the District Service Center or can be viewed online.

div.a: Read More about Notice: 2019-2020 Proposed Final Budget Available for Public Inspection

a.span: Image for WAHS Students, Teacher Recognize Local Car Dealership for State Competition Training

strong.a: WAHS Students, Teacher Recognize Local Car Dealership for State Competition Training

div.div: Two WAHS students recently took fifth place at the Pennsylvania Automotive Association Technology Competition. Seniors Alan Cortright and Weston Koser were the two WAHS contenders from among the 10 participating Pennsylvania high schools.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Students, Teacher Recognize Local Car Dealership for State Competition Training

a.span: Image for WAHS Team Ranks Among Top 3 at Recent Envirothon

strong.a: WAHS Team Ranks Among Top 3 at Recent Envirothon

div.div: A group WAHS students ranked among the top three at the 33rd annual Envirothon held recently at the Consolidated Sportsmen of Lycoming County along Route 87. Of the 21 contending teams, the WAHS group took second place for Lycoming County and third place overall.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Team Ranks Among Top 3 at Recent Envirothon

a.span: Image for 37 WAMS Students Inducted into National Junior Honor Society

strong.a: 37 WAMS Students Inducted into National Junior Honor Society

div.div: Thirty-seven middle school students were inducted into the National Junior Honor Society. The ceremony, held in the middle school auditorium, honored each of the inductees who represent what are known as The Four Pillars of NJHS: scholarship, service, leadership and character.

div.a: Read More about 37 WAMS Students Inducted into National Junior Honor Society

a.span: Image for WAHS Students Produce "Infinite Inspiration" Arts Publication

strong.a: WAHS Students Produce "Infinite Inspiration" Arts Publication

div.div: After months in the making, WAHS artists and writers received their very own copy of "Infinite Inspiration" today. The publication is compilation of visual and written works created during a free, four-day summer workshop for students interested in further developing their artistic talent.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Students Produce "Infinite Inspiration" Arts Publication

a.span: Image for WAHS Students Honored for Placement in Recent Welding Competition

strong.a: WAHS Students Honored for Placement in Recent Welding Competition

div.div: WAHS senior Zackery Gates and junior Adam Roush were honored at Pennsylvania College of Technology recently for placing sixth and third, respectively, in the American Welding Society’s Welding Competition.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Students Honored for Placement in Recent Welding Competition

a.span: Image for 46 WAHS Students Attend Model UN, Earn Several Awards

strong.a: 46 WAHS Students Attend Model UN, Earn Several Awards

div.div: Among the 150 area high school students who attended this year’s Model United Nations event at Lycoming College on April 5 were 46 WAHS students, who collectively or individually brought home a number of awards and recognitions

div.a: Read More about 46 WAHS Students Attend Model UN, Earn Several Awards

a.span: Image for WASD Once Again Among Nation's 'Best Communities for Music Education'

strong.a: WASD Once Again Among Nation's 'Best Communities for Music Education'

div.div: WASD has once again been recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education. This is the 17th time in 18 years that WASD has received the designation

div.a: Read More about WASD Once Again Among Nation's 'Best Communities for Music Education'

a.span: Image for 2 WASD OM Teams Advance to 2019 World Finals

strong.a: 2 WASD OM Teams Advance to 2019 World Finals

div.div: Two Williamsport Area School District Odyssey of the Mind teams will head to the 2019 World Finals after securing first- and second-place wins at the state round Saturday at Pocono Mountain East Campus.

div.a: Read More about 2 WASD OM Teams Advance to 2019 World Finals

a.span: Image for WASD Teacher Named Penn State School of Music's Outstanding Alumni Music Educator

strong.a: WASD Teacher Named Penn State School of Music's Outstanding Alumni Music Educator

div.div: Anna Radspinner has been named Penn State School of Music’s 2018-2019 Outstanding Alumni Music Educator. According to the music school, the award recognizes “outstanding Penn State alumni for distinguished service to K-12 music programs.”

div.a: Read More about WASD Teacher Named Penn State School of Music's Outstanding Alumni Music Educator

a.span: Image for WAHS 2019 Summer School Enrollment Opens

strong.a: WAHS 2019 Summer School Enrollment Opens

div.div: Registration is open to enroll in summer courses at WAHS. The high school will offer two forms of summer courses: credit acceleration and credit recovery to all high school students. Registration deadline is June 6. Classes begin June 11.

div.a: Read More about WAHS 2019 Summer School Enrollment Opens

a.span: Image for New Elementary Special Education Supervisor Begins at WASD

strong.a: New Elementary Special Education Supervisor Begins at WASD

div.div: Coleen Genovese began as WASD's new elementary special education supervisor this week. Genovese comes to the district from the Benton Area School District, where she most recently served as its K-12 director of curriculum and instruction and director of grant writing and federal programs.

div.a: Read More about New Elementary Special Education Supervisor Begins at WASD

a.span: Image for Brandon Coleman Named WASD's New Supervisor of Pupil Transportation, School Safety

strong.a: Brandon Coleman Named WASD's New Supervisor of Pupil Transportation, School Safety

div.div: Mr. Brandon Coleman was recently named Supervisor of Pupil Transportation and School Safety at WASD. Coleman, who begins April 1, comes to WASD from Keystone Central School District, where he’s held the position of the district’s supervisor of police and transportation since 2009.

div.a: Read More about Brandon Coleman Named WASD's New Supervisor of Pupil Transportation, School Safety

a.span: Image for Vote for WAMS in 'What's So Cool About Manufacturing?'

strong.a: Vote for WAMS in 'What's So Cool About Manufacturing?'

div.div: What's so cool about manufacturing? Let our students tell you! Check and vote (between now and 11:59 p.m. Thursday, March 27) for Williamsport Area Middle School students. The contest features schools from Lycoming and Sullivan counties.

div.a: Read More about Vote for WAMS in 'What's So Cool About Manufacturing?'

a.span: Image for Extensive Roadwork to Begin in Newberry on April 1

strong.a: Extensive Roadwork to Begin in Newberry on April 1

div.div: Please be advised that extensive roadwork will begin in the Newberry section of Williamsport beginning Monday, April 1, and is expected to last through the end of August. The construction work will have significant impact on travel.

div.a: Read More about Extensive Roadwork to Begin in Newberry on April 1

a.span: Image for 'Wounds You Cannot See': Author Rodney Walker Returns to WAHS

strong.a: 'Wounds You Cannot See': Author Rodney Walker Returns to WAHS

div.div: Author and youth advocate Rodney Walker returned to WAHS to work with about 70 students who have been through adverse experiences. He led students through a workshop called "Wounds You Cannot See," offering them strategies on how to work toward healing and positive growth.

div.a: Read More about 'Wounds You Cannot See': Author Rodney Walker Returns to WAHS

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Grants $12,304 to 2 District Programs

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Grants $12,304 to 2 District Programs

div.div: The Williamsport Area School District Education Foundation (WASDEF) has announced it has awarded $12,304 through its 2018-2019 Challenge Grant Program to benefit two district programs.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Grants $12,304 to 2 District Programs

a.span: Image for Students Explore Post-Secondary Opportunities at WAHS's 2nd Career Fair

strong.a: Students Explore Post-Secondary Opportunities at WAHS's 2nd Career Fair

div.div: WAHS hosted its second Career Fair on March 14 during which 55 business, organizations, agencies, colleges and universities, and military branches were present. Students were able to interact with those from many industries and explore the post-secondary opportunities available to them.

div.a: Read More about Students Explore Post-Secondary Opportunities at WAHS's 2nd Career Fair

a.span: Image for Imagine Your Impact: Raise the Region

strong.a: Imagine Your Impact: Raise the Region

div.div: For a 30-hour period beginning at 6 p.m. on March 13, the community will have the chance to support the WASD Education Foundation by participating in the First Community Foundation Partnership of Pennsylvania’s Raise the Region online fundraising event.

div.a: Read More about Imagine Your Impact: Raise the Region

a.span: Image for WASD Spring Newsletter Now Available

strong.a: WASD Spring Newsletter Now Available

div.div: The district's spring newsletter is now available! Check out what's been happening, what's new, and read about what's in store for the season ahead!

div.a: Read More about WASD Spring Newsletter Now Available

a.span: Image for Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Scheduled for March 18-22

strong.a: Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Scheduled for March 18-22

div.div: WASD's kindergarten and new student enrollment week for the 2019-2020 school year is scheduled for March 18 through March 22 at the District Service Center. Registrations will be handled alphabetically by last name from 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

div.a: Read More about Kindergarten, New Student Registration Week Scheduled for March 18-22

a.span: Image for All 8 WASD Odyssey of the Mind Teams Advance to State Finals

strong.a: All 8 WASD Odyssey of the Mind Teams Advance to State Finals

div.div: All eight WASD Odyssey of the Mind teams that competed at the Regional Tournament in Berwick on Saturday are headed to the State Finals. Contending teams from WASD represented Cochran Primary School, Curtin Intermediate School, WAMS and WAHS.

div.a: Read More about All 8 WASD Odyssey of the Mind Teams Advance to State Finals

a.span: Image for WAHS Sophomore Selected to Perform With National Youth Orchestra of the U.S.

strong.a: WAHS Sophomore Selected to Perform With National Youth Orchestra of the U.S.

div.div: At just 15 years old, WAHS sophomore Michael Fisher is already a veteran to the music scene. Now, this summer, he’ll unleash his talent across Europe alongside his peers as a member of Carnegie Hall’s Weill Music Institute’s National Youth Orchestra of the United States.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Sophomore Selected to Perform With National Youth Orchestra of the U.S.

a.span: Image for Over the Edge: Williamsport to Return This Fall

strong.a: Over the Edge: Williamsport to Return This Fall

div.div: In collaboration with River Valley Regional YMCA and YWCA Northcentral PA, the WASD Education Foundation is pleased to announce the return of Over the Edge: Williamsport this fall. The event, scheduled for Saturday, Oct. 26, 2019, is a fundraising partnership between the three nonprofits.

div.a: Read More about Over the Edge: Williamsport to Return This Fall

a.span: Image for #TechTuesdays: Educational Technology in the Elementary Classroom

strong.a: #TechTuesdays: Educational Technology in the Elementary Classroom

div.div: In five weekly installments, we've taken you inside our elementary classrooms to show our community how technology is being used to help enhance learning and instruction.

div.a: Read More about #TechTuesdays: Educational Technology in the Elementary Classroom

a.span: Image for 8 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

strong.a: 8 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

div.div: Eight eighth-grade students at Williamsport Area Middle School recently were recognized for earning Scholastic Art & Writing Awards. “The Scholastic Art & Writing Awards are the nation’s longest-running and most prestigious recognition program for creative teens in grades 7–12,” according to the contest’s website.

div.a: Read More about 8 WAMS Students Earn Scholastic Art & Writing Awards

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Seeks Nominations for 2019 Distinguished Alumni

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Seeks Nominations for 2019 Distinguished Alumni

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation is seeking nominations for the district’s 2019 Distinguished Alumni. The 2019 recipients will be inducted into the WAHS Distinguished Alumni Wall of Fame and invited to attend an award presentation at the foundation’s second Donor Appreciation Event and Awards Ceremony in September.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Seeks Nominations for 2019 Distinguished Alumni

a.span: Image for WAHS Students Raises, Donates $10,500 to Local Causes

strong.a: WAHS Students Raises, Donates $10,500 to Local Causes

div.div: WAHS sophomore Cecilia Fink recently donated $10,500 to support two local causes: the Livestrong program at the YMCA and 6-year-old Declan Bower, who is battling leukemia. This is Fink’s fifth year supporting local programs and individuals in need through her charity, Be You Boldly.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Students Raises, Donates $10,500 to Local Causes

a.span: Image for WAHS Wins 2019 Governor's STEM Competition

strong.a: WAHS Wins 2019 Governor's STEM Competition

div.div: Congratulations to a team of seven WAHS students for taking the win today at the regional level of the 2019 Governor's STEM Competition at Pennsylvania College of Technology!

div.a: Read More about WAHS Wins 2019 Governor's STEM Competition

a.span: Image for 11 WAHS Students Perform with PMEA District 8 Honors Band

strong.a: 11 WAHS Students Perform with PMEA District 8 Honors Band

div.div: Eleven WAHS music students performed on Jan. 25 with the Pennsylvania Music Educators Association (PMEA) District 8 Honors Band.

div.a: Read More about 11 WAHS Students Perform with PMEA District 8 Honors Band

a.span: Image for Health & Wellness at WASD

strong.a: Health & Wellness at WASD

div.div: Many choose to start off a new year with a resolution to be more active or plan to adopt a healthier lifestyle. Take a look inside our health and physical education department and learn how our team of educators work to teach and encourage that behavior to all our students all year round.

div.a: Read More about Health & Wellness at WASD

a.span: Image for WAHS Drama Department to Bring 'Clue' to the Stage

strong.a: WAHS Drama Department to Bring 'Clue' to the Stage

div.div: There’s a mystery to be solved at WAHS, as the drama department is hard at work to bring “Clue” to the stage the first weekend in February. Performances are scheduled for 7 p.m. on Feb. 1 and Feb. 2. A matinée show will begin at 2 p.m. on Feb. 3.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Drama Department to Bring 'Clue' to the Stage

a.span: Image for YMCA Donates Holiday Gift Items for Students

strong.a: YMCA Donates Holiday Gift Items for Students

div.div: Thanks to the generosity of River Valley Regional YMCA and its Executive Director Sonja Davy, some students in need will receive gifts this holiday season. Through its Angel Tree, the YMCA asked its members to purchase coats, backpacks, pants, socks, scarves and hats for students of all ages in the district.

div.a: Read More about YMCA Donates Holiday Gift Items for Students

a.span: Image for WAHS Senior Treyson Potts Signs with University of Minnesota

strong.a: WAHS Senior Treyson Potts Signs with University of Minnesota

div.div: WAHS senior Treyson Potts signed his letter of intent this morning to continue his football career at the collegiate level at the University of Minnesota next fall.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Senior Treyson Potts Signs with University of Minnesota

a.span: Image for WAHS Teacher Clark Sarge Earns FANUC Certification

strong.a: WAHS Teacher Clark Sarge Earns FANUC Certification

div.div: An additional opportunity for students to earn industry certification is now available through Clark Sarge’s engineering and robotics class at Williamsport Area High School.

div.a: Read More about WAHS Teacher Clark Sarge Earns FANUC Certification

a.span: Image for WASD's 2018 Year in Review

strong.a: WASD's 2018 Year in Review

div.div: From advancing academic programs to district championships to celebrating alumni, WASD invites you to take a look back at its journey through 2018.

div.a: Read More about WASD's 2018 Year in Review

a.span: Image for Jackson Primary Sends Care Packages to Soldiers Overseas

strong.a: Jackson Primary Sends Care Packages to Soldiers Overseas

div.div: Continuing its annual tradition, the Jackson Primary School community donated items for members of our soldiers overseas in Afghanistan. The care boxes were picked up this morning by Marine Corps League members Keith Miller and Mike Dunlap to begin their journey abroad.

div.a: Read More about Jackson Primary Sends Care Packages to Soldiers Overseas

a.span: Image for WASD Expands Safety Measures with 'Stop the Bleed' Training, Kits

strong.a: WASD Expands Safety Measures with 'Stop the Bleed' Training, Kits

div.div: In partnership with UPMC Susquehanna, WASD continues to train all district employees this year in the national Stop the Bleed initiative. Today, 16 Stop the Bleed kits, each containing eight individual kits, were delivered to the district for installation at each of its school buildings for public accessibility.

div.a: Read More about WASD Expands Safety Measures with 'Stop the Bleed' Training, Kits

a.span: Image for 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

strong.a: 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation recently concluded its annual Holiday Essay Contest, during which students in kindergarten through sixth grade were asked to answer, in 200 words or less: “What does the holiday season mean to you and why?”

div.a: Read More about 25 Winners Selected in WASD Education Foundation Holiday Essay Contest

a.span: Image for WASD Education Foundation Grants $24,000 to Programs, Initiatives

strong.a: WASD Education Foundation Grants $24,000 to Programs, Initiatives

div.div: The WASD Education Foundation announced it recently awarded $24,009 in grants to support six programs and initiatives across the district. Those awarded were among the foundation’s first this school year that have the potential to impact thousands of student now and into the future.

div.a: Read More about WASD Education Foundation Grants $24,000 to Programs, Initiatives

br.h2: What do these people have in common?

div.p: NFL Coach and Former NFL player
Designer, Painter
Actress
Former CEO of Merrill Lynch & Co.
Congressman
Television Producer & Humanitarian
College Professor & Historian
U.S. Army Veteran & PA State Trooper
Football Coach
CNN News Producer
Nuclear Submarine Commander
Long-Distance Runner
They are all Williamsport Area School District graduates.

div.h2: Williamsport welcomes the world, because our children are prepared for the world.
div.p: No matter what paths our graduates follow, we know one thing—they were on their path well before graduation.

p.strong: Williamsport Area School District provides a 5-pronged approach to education at all levels:

img.alt: Smart Start in a Nurturing Foundation
img.title: Smart Start in a Nurturing Foundation

a.span: Previous
Next

div.p: Smart Start in a Nurturing Foundation
Family-like neighborhood primary schools starting with all-day kindergarten, providing a full, immersive learning experience.

a.span: Previous
Next

div.p: College and Career Ready Graduates

Students are prepared for careers and college through comprehensive academic and career pathways; Career and Technical Education (CTE), Advanced Placement, Academic Excellence, STEM, and Dual Enrollment. Children are introduced to many different careers beginning in primary school.

a.span: Previous
Next

div.p: Expansive Student Opportunities
All students can find their interest and passion through expansive curricular and co-curricular opportunities--no matter their interest or aptitude, we will foster it.

a.span: Previous
Next

div.p: World-Class Arts and Music Programs
Celebrating the joy and exceptional talents of students within a vibrant arts community, the arts can assist in learning, as well as developing opportunities for self-expression and self-esteem.

a.span: Previous
Next

div.p: Community Support and Giving
Williamsport Education Foundation creates powerful classrooms and inspires futures by funding the enhancement of educational programming and opportunities.

ol.li: Smart Start in a Nurturing Foundation

a.span: Previous
Next
